subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Complex Eigenvalues
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to find complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
name: Characteristic Polynomial" },
statementHtml: Given the matrix A = [[1, 2], [3, 4]], find its complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
hints: Start by finding the characteristic polynomial.
Use the quadratic formula to find the roots.
solutionHtml:
To solve this problem, we'll follow these steps:

  • Find the characteristic polynomial: \\[ \det(A - \\lambda I) = 0 \\]
  • Equate the determinant to zero and expand: \\[ (1-\\lambda)(4-3\\lambda) - 2*3 = 0 \\]
  • Simplify the equation and factor: \\[ (-\\lambda + 1)(-\\lambda + 2) = 0 \\]
  • Find the roots using the quadratic formula: \\[ \\lambda = \\frac{1 \\pm i\\sqrt{3}}{2} \\]
  • Finding the corresponding eigenvectors involves solving (A - \\lambda I)v = 0.
",
answerShort: The complex eigenvalues are \\( \\frac{1 \\pm i\\sqrt{3}}{2} \\) and the eigenvectors are not shown in this example." },
problemHtml: Given the matrix A = [[1, 2], [3, 4]], find its complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the characteristic polynomial", "mathHtml": "\\[ \det(A - \\lambda I) = 0 \\]", "explanation": "This is the starting point for finding the eigenvalues."} ],
intuition: Complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors can be used to model rotations in higher-dimensional spaces, which is useful in computer graphics and machine learning.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Complex Eigenvalues
contentHtml: In this example, we'll explore how to find complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors in a matrix.
name: Eigenvalue Equation" },
statementHtml: Find the complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the matrix A = [[1, -2], [3, -4]]
hints: Hint: Start by finding the characteristic polynomial
solutionHtml:
We'll use the characteristic polynomial to find the eigenvalues. The characteristic polynomial is given by:

\\[P(\\lambda) = \\det(A - \\lambda I) = 0\\]

Solving for \\lambda, we get:

\\[\lambda^2 + 3\\lambda + 2 = 0\\]

This has complex roots: \\lambda_1 = (-3 + i\\sqrt{7})/2 and \\lambda_2 = (-3 - i\\sqrt{7})/2

",
problemHtml: Find the complex eigenvectors corresponding to each eigenvalue.

steps.explanation: We set up the eigenvector equation and solve for \mathbf{x}
We set up the eigenvector equation and solve for \mathbf{x}

steps.description: Normalize the eigenvectors to have length 1
steps.explanation: We normalize the eigenvectors to ensure they are unit vectors

intuition: Complex eigenvalues can be used to model rotations in higher-dimensional spaces, making them essential for many machine learning algorithms.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Complex Eigenvalues
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to find complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
name: Eigenvalue Equation" },
statementHtml: Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the matrix A = [[2, -3], [1, 1]].
problemHtml: Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the matrix A = [[2, -3], [1, 1]].
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Compute the characteristic polynomial", "mathHtml": "\\[\\det(A - \\lambda I) = (2-\\lambda)^2 + 1^2\]", "explanation": "We're finding the eigenvalues by solving the characteristic equation."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Factor the polynomial", "mathHtml": "\\[(2-\\lambda)^2 + 1^2 = (\\lambda - 1)^2 + 4\]", "explanation": "Factoring helps us find the roots of the polynomial."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find the complex roots", "mathHtml": "\\[\\lambda = \\frac{1}{2} \\pm i \\sqrt{3}\]", "explanation": "The quadratic formula gives us the two complex eigenvalues."}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Compute the corresponding eigenvectors", "mathHtml": "\\[A \\mathbf{x}_1 = \\frac{1}{2} \\mathbf{x}_1 + i \\sqrt{3} \\mathbf{x}_1\]", "explanation": "We find the eigenvectors by solving the eigenvalue equation."} ],
finalAnswer: The complex eigenvalues are λ = 1/2 ± i√3, and the corresponding eigenvectors are unknown." },
intuition: Complex eigenvalues can be used to model rotations in higher-dimensional spaces.
visualDescription: A diagram showing the rotation of a vector around the origin would help illustrate this concept.
realWorldApplications: Modeling rotations in computer graphics and game development

subject: linear_algebra
title: Solving Complex Eigenvalues
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to find complex eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix.
statementHtml:
Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the following matrix:


\[ \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 3 & 2 \end{bmatrix}\] ",
problemHtml:
Given the matrix A = \[\begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 3 & 2 \end{bmatrix}\], we want to find its eigenvalues and eigenvectors.

",
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the characteristic polynomial", "mathHtml": "\\[ P(\lambda) = |A - \\lambda I| = 0 \\]", "explanation": "The characteristic polynomial is a polynomial equation that has the eigenvalues as its roots."}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Factor the characteristic polynomial", "mathHtml": "\\[ P(\\lambda) = (\\lambda - 1)(\\lambda + 1) \\]", "explanation": "Factoring the polynomial helps us identify the eigenvalues."}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Find the eigenvectors corresponding to each eigenvalue", "mathHtml": "\\[ v_1 = \\begin{bmatrix} -1 \\\\ 1 \\end{bmatrix}, v_2 = \\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\\\ -1 \\end{bmatrix} \\]", "explanation": "The eigenvectors are the non-zero vectors that, when transformed by A, result in scaled versions of themselves."}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Verify the eigenvalues and eigenvectors", "mathHtml": "\\[ Av_1 = 2v_1, Av_2 = -2v_2 \\]", "explanation": "We can verify that A multiplied by each eigenvector results in a scaled version of itself."} ],
finalAnswer: The eigenvalues are 1 and -1, with corresponding eigenvectors v_1 and v_2." },
visualDescription: A diagram showing the transformation of an initial vector by A could help illustrate the concept.
commonMistakes: Forgetting to factor the characteristic polynomial
realWorldApplications: Eigenvalues are used in machine learning for dimensionality reduction and feature extraction.
